meanings.def: having the colour of grass or the leaves of most plants and trees
examples: green grass/leaves/vegetables
his piercing green eyes
Wait for the light to turn green (= on traffic lights).
an olive green carpet
the lush green grass
wearing an emerald green dress

meanings.def: covered with grass or other plants
examples: green fields/pastures/hills
It's just two minutes' walk to the nearest public green space.
After the rains, the land was green with new growth.
green tomatoes

meanings.def: connected with the protection of the environment; supporting the protection of the environment as a political principle
examples: green energy
green politics
Try to adopt a greener lifestyle.
the Green Party
The new trainees are still very green.

meanings.def: being a pale colour, as if the person is going to vomit
examples: It was a rough crossing and most of the passengers looked distinctly green.

meanings.def: said about people who never seem happy with what they have and always think they could be happier in a different place or situation
very jealous (= angry or unhappy because you wish you had something that somebody else has )

idioms.idiom: the grass is (always) greener on the other side (of the fence)
idioms.def: said about people who never seem happy with what they have and always think they could be happier in a different place or situation
very jealous (= angry or unhappy because you wish you had something that somebody else has )

meanings.def: the colour of grass and the leaves of most plants and trees
examples: light/pale green
bright/emerald green
a striking shade of bright green
Their leaves are a dark green.
the green of the countryside in spring
She was dressed all in green.
The room was decorated in a combination of greens and blues.

meanings.def: vegetables with dark green leaves, for example cabbage or spinach
examples: Eat up your greens.
Young leaves may be eaten as salad greens.
It’s important to eat fresh greens every day.

meanings.def: an area of grass, especially in the middle of a town or village
examples: Children were playing on the village green.

meanings.def: an area of grass cut short around a hole on a golf course
examples: the 18th green
Did the ball land on the green?

meanings.def: the Green Party (= the party whose main aim is the protection of the environment)
to create parks and other areas with trees and plants in a city
examples: projects for greening the cities

meanings.def: to make somebody more aware of issues connected with the environment; to make something appear friendly towards the environment
examples: an attempt to green industry bosses
